steps.title: Fill a bowl or bucket with warm water.
steps.content: Fill a bowl or bucket with warm water.

steps.title: Choose the desired number of gourds you want to paint.
steps.content: Choose the desired number of gourds you want to paint. The gourds should be at least 6 inches (15.2 cm) in length, not counting the stems.

steps.title: Wrap a dishtowel around each gourd.
steps.content: Wrap a dishtowel around each gourd. Dishtowels help keep the entire gourds underwater instead of floating to the surface.

steps.title: Submerge the draped gourds into the bowl or bucket of warm water.
steps.content: Submerge the draped gourds into the bowl or bucket of warm water. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Allow your gourds to soak for approximately 4 hours to soften the skin.
steps.content: Allow your gourds to soak for approximately 4 hours to soften the skin.

steps.title: Rub the skin off the gourds gently, using steel wool.
steps.content: Rub the skin off the gourds gently, using steel wool. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Rinse the gourds thoroughly and allow them to sit overnight or until they are completely dry.
steps.content: Rinse the gourds thoroughly and allow them to sit overnight or until they are completely dry.

steps.title: Apply a water seal if the gourd will be used outside and allow it to dry.
steps.content: Apply a water seal if the gourd will be used outside and allow it to dry. Paint the gourd with an oil-based primer in the areas that will be decorated and allow it to dry. This makes a solid surface for your art.

steps.title: Gather all the paints you would like to use and begin with a base coat.
steps.content: Gather all the paints you would like to use and begin with a base coat. This could be an acrylic or oil-based paint. You can also use a spray paint.

steps.title: Draw any desired designs on your gourds using a pencil or marker if desired.
steps.content: Draw any desired designs on your gourds using a pencil or marker if desired. You can skip this step if you prefer to paint the designs free-hand. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Apply paint to your designs with paintbrushes or sponges using small strokes and a light amount of paint.
steps.content: Apply paint to your designs with paintbrushes or sponges using small strokes and a light amount of paint. You may also spray the paint, just make sure to spray lightly and at a distance of at least 10 inches (25.4 cm) to prevent the paint from running or dripping.

steps.title: Allow the freshly-painted gourds to dry thoroughly once more.
steps.content: Allow the freshly-painted gourds to dry thoroughly once more.

steps.title: Coat the gourds with clear paint or an acrylic quick-drying sealer to give it a glossy finish and prevent scratching or peeling.
steps.content: Coat the gourds with clear paint or an acrylic quick-drying sealer to give it a glossy finish and prevent scratching or peeling. [5] X Research source
